newsitem.title: USA: ITT Hartford sees fund assets at $400 mln.
newsitem.headline: ITT Hartford sees fund assets at $400 mln.

text.p: The retail mutual funds recently unveiled by ITT Hartford Group Inc are expected to grow to $400 million in assets by the end of this year, according to an ITT Hartford executive.

The eight funds, which were declared effective by the Securities and Exchange Commission in July, currently have assets of about $50 million, according to David Levenson, director of mutual funds for ITT Hartford.
ITT has offered funds since 1977 as part of its annuity business, and the new funds are being offered as stand-alone retail products.
Levenson spoke to Reuters after an ITT marketing road show for the funds to financial advisers here.
The eight funds include Small Company, Capital Appreciation, International Opportunities, Stock, Dividend and Growth, Advisers, a balanced fund, Bond Income Strategy, and Money Market.
Levenson said the funds, with a 5.5 percent front load, are being offered through brokers and banks.
The older annuity-related funds include the $5 billion Advisers, and the $1.9 billion Stock Fund.
SEC rules require separate fund products be created in order for them to be offered through retail outlets.
